snippet: Up to 50,000 people have fled violence in a remote border area, the United Nations said Monday, after days of fighting between two ethnic groups over cattle raids.
abstract: Up to 50,000 people have fled violence in remote border area of South Sudan, after days of fighting between two ethnic groups over cattle raids.
lead_paragraph: Up to 50,000 people have fled violence in a remote border area, the United Nations said Monday, after days of fighting between two ethnic groups over cattle raids.
